title: Google drops plans to make NNAPI drivers updatable through Google Play Services
content:
At its I/O developer conference last year, Google announced that it was working with Qualcomm to make the Neural Network APIs (NNAPIs) that power AI/ML features in Android updatable through Google Play Services starting with Android 12. The idea behind this move was to reduce fragmentation and allow developers to use the same NNAPI spec

The post Google drops plans to make NNAPI drivers updatable through Google Play Services appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Google has reportedly dropped its plan to make NNAPI updatable through Google Play Services. The company hasn't shared any details about this change, though.
